name: PaperMC
description: PaperMC improves Minecraft's ecosystem with fast, secure software and an expanding plugin API, providing quick releases and helpful support as the most widely used, performant, and stable software available. Also this installation includes MCDash plugin â€“ a simple dashboard for your Minecraft server. It allows you to see the current status of your server, the online players, console and more.

notes.text: After server is launched, connect once using Minecraft Client (both Java and Bedrock are supported) with a user you plan to make a server operator.
Next, stop service `systemctl stop minecraft`, start using the shell script `sudo -u minecraft /opt/minecraft/start.sh`, and make an operator by running `op .<username>` (Note: the dot is required).
To create your password, you have to execute the following command either in the console or in-game `panel <password>`
Once password is set, you can login to MCDash Web Console, by visiting http://<IP>:7867. Login `CONSOLE` or `<minecraft user>` depending of where the panel password was set.
Finally, stop the minecraft process (Ctrl+C), start the service `systemctl start minecraft`. Further, MCDash allows to run server commands.
